captions.text:
<i>You're gonna need a blanket</i>
<i>and suntan lotion,</i>

'cause you're never gonna
get off that beach!

You will not
make this putt, ya jackass!
That was not nice and easy.

You know what's
driving me crazy?

You not getting
the ball in the hole.

Don't push me, Bob.
Now's not the time.

<i>[ Heckler, Crowd Laughing ]</i>
This guy sucks!

We haven't seen Happy Gilmore
play this badly since
his first day on tour.

<i>He and Bob Barker</i>
<i>are now dead last.</i>

I can't believe
you're a professional golfer.

I think you should be
working at the snack bar.

You better relax, Bob.
There is no way...

that you could have been
as bad at hockey
as you are at golf.

- [ Grunts ]
- You like that, old man?
You want a piece of me?

I don't want a piece of you.
I want the whole thing!

title: The Price Is Wrong, Bitch - Happy Gilmore (8/9) Movie CLIP (1996) HD

comments.author: joiless

comments.text:
Happy threw the first punch.  Bob then had every right to knock out this 
young punk.

Adam Sandler is not playing a character who approaches life in some calm, 
rational manner.  Happy is written to have serious anger issues, and it is 
ultimately by learning to suppress and overcome these tendencies that he 
achieves success.

If you mean to imply that this film is going to corrupt children and teach 
them the wrong message, perhaps watch the entire movie if you haven't 
already.

comments.text:
30 DAY MOVIE CHALLENGE
Thanks +Red Mattos  for the idea

*Day 06 - Your favorite comedy movie*
Hard one ... So many to choose.  I'll go with Happy Gilmore for the "The 
Price Is Wrong, Bitch" scene.

================================

*Day 01 - Your favorite movie*
 The Shawshank Redemption

*Day 02 - The last movie you watched*
 3 Days to kill (2014) - Review=Meh

*Day 03 - Your favorite action/adventure movie*
The Matrix because of his innovative visual effects for time of his release 
and also for the great imaginative approach to the characters and scenes.

*Day 04 - Your favorite horror movie*
The Exorcist.

*Day 05 - Your favorite drama movie*
Good Will Hunting (1997)

Day 07 - A movie that makes you happy
Day 08 - A movie that makes you sad
Day 09 - A movie that you know practically the whole script of
Day 10 - Your favorite director
Day 11 - Your favorite movie from your childhood
Day 12 - Your favorite animated movie

Day 14 - Your favorite quote from any movie
Day 15 - The first movie you saw in theaters

Day 18 - A movie that disappointed you the most
Day 19 - Your favorite actor
Day 20 - Your favorite actress
Day 21 - The most overrated movie
Day 22 - The most underrated movie

Day 24 - Favorite documentary
Day 25 - A movie that no one would expect you to love
Day 26 - A movie that is a guilty pleasure
Day 27 - Favorite classic movie
Day 28 - Movie with the best soundtrack
Day 29 - A movie that changed your opinion about something
Day 30 - Your least favorite movie


So who else is up for a  #30DayMovieChallenge ?﻿

comments.author: ZeronesXX

comments.text:
Did I see Chretien on the leaderboard there?  This scene was supposedly 
filmed at a course near Vancouver.  In case you're wondering who he is, 
Jean Chretien was then the Canadian prime minister.  He really likes golf.
Also, about the fight, in case you haven't read Bob Barker's book, he 
mentions the only part of the fight he didn't do was rolling down the 
hill.  Those were stuntmen who did that portion.  Everything else was Adam 
Sandler and Bob Barker.  I believe that fight won them an MTV movie award.﻿
